page.title: 13A DAY IN THE LIFE OF ...
page.content: I get up at seven thirty and put on my school uniform, a blue check dress in summer or a navy skirt, white shirt and jumper if it is winter. For breakfast I usually have toast and cereal. At eight thirty I go outside and wait fot the school taxi (which is really a minibus) and we arrive at school quite early where I play with my friends until the bell rings at nine. First we read and then we go into assembly where one of the teachers talks to us and we sing some hymns. We do maths or english in the morning then we have our dinner, I buy a school dinner but some children bring sandwiches, and then we play until school starts again. In the afternoon we sometimes do something exciting like games. We go home at quarter past three.
